intro: Thornea matudae, commonly known as the Matudae thornplant, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Costa Rica. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and thorny branches. The plant produces small, showy flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in secondary growth areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
